meanings.definition: A category within a taxonomic system, below a taxon.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study different subtaxons to understand the diversity of species.
meanings.sent2: The subtaxons of mammals include primates, rodents, and carnivores.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper organized the animals into subtaxons for a fun educational tour.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, each tree species represents a unique subtaxon in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the subtaxons of insects revealed fascinating patterns of evolution.

meanings.sent1: The biologist classified the new subtaxons based on genetic similarities.
meanings.sent2: Each subtaxon of birds has distinct characteristics that set them apart.
meanings.sent3: The chef divided the recipe into subtaxons for easier cooking instructions.
meanings.sent4: The subtaxons of plants in the garden flourished under different conditions.
meanings.sent5: Identifying the subtaxons of fish helped in preserving endangered species.
